posts.post_content:
Updated on Sunday with three more postcards. Descriptions below the initial card listed, which was the 1920 World Series PC.

1920 World Series postcard -- Description from Prestige Collectibles, an authority on Japanese baseball cards and memorabilia:

This postcard was distributed in 1921. It features Japanese HOFer Daisuke Miyake, Larry Gardner of the Indians and a Japanese reporter named Takada. The image was taken at Game 1 of the 1920 World Series at Ebbets Field. Unused. $350 delivered within the United States

American League Publishing Co. -- George Stoval, with Collister & Sayle ad on front, Cleveland schedule on back. Trimmed, but every one in series with the ad that I've seen is trimmed. In an SGC A holder. $1,250 delivered within the U.S. 
 
Raymond Kahn -- Stovall, Berger, Congalton, Bemis. SOLD

Unusual postcard of 18 Cleveland players in both home and away uniforms posing outdoors. Got this in a Hunt auction, don't know much about it. I can't find a link on Hunt's website (shocker). I do remember that in the auction description, Hunt severely understated the amount of paper remnants on the back of the postcard -- and didn't show a scan of the back (another shocker). $600 delivered within the U.S.

PayPal is fine. No need to "gift" your payment. (Check, cash, money order also OK and preferred).

A commitment to buy takes precedence over an ongoing negotiation. :rolleyes: 

[URL="wolfie51sb@aol.com"]Feel free to email any questions.[/URL]

Thanks,

Rob

[URL="wolfie51sb@aol.com"]wolfie51sb at aol dot com[/URL]

[IMG]http://photos.imageevent.com/ineedanap/otherphotos/Item_3005_1.jpg[/IMG]

[IMG]http://photos.imageevent.com/ineedanap/otherphotos/Item_3005_2.jpg[/IMG]

[IMG]http://photos.imageevent.com/ineedanap/otherphotos/3-cle-pc-fb.jpg[/IMG]

posts.post_title: Will take Raymond Kahn pc, thanks
posts.post_content: Will take Raymond Kahn, please. Email for payment instructions sent.
